title: Athletics at the 2001 Southeast Asian Games
text:
At the <a href="2001%20Southeast%20Asian%20Games">2001 Southeast Asian Games</a>, the <a href="Athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a> events were held in <a href="Kuala%20Lumpur">Kuala Lumpur</a>, <a href="Malaysia">Malaysia</a>. A total of 46 events were contested, of which 24 by male and 22 by female athletes. The <a href="track%20and%20field">track and field</a> events were hosted at the <a href="National%20Stadium%2C%20Bukit%20Jalil">National Stadium, Bukit Jalil</a>, the <a href="marathon">marathon</a>s were held around <a href="Merdeka%20Square%2C%20Kuala%20Lumpur">Merdeka Square</a>, and the <a href="racewalking">racewalking</a> events took place at <a href="Titiwangsa%20Lake%20Gardens">Titiwangsa Lake Gardens</a>.
Seven of the ten competing nations reached the medal table. <a href="Thailand">Thailand</a>, traditionally the regional leader in athletics, was the most successful nation, winning twenty-two gold medals and forty-one in total. The <a href="Philippines">Philippines</a> and Malaysia each won eight gold medals, with the Philippines edging into second with a medal haul of 23 (one more than the hosts). <a href="Indonesia">Indonesia</a> and <a href="Vietnam">Vietnam</a> respectively won 22 and 17 medals overall.
Three new women's events were introduced at the 21st edition of the competition: <a href="pole%20vault">pole vault</a>, <a href="hammer%20throw">hammer throw</a>, and the <a href="20%20km%20race%20walk">20 km race walk</a>. Apart from the new events, eight previous <a href="List%20of%20Southeast%20Asian%20Games%20records%20in%20athletics">games records</a> were beaten at the competition, as well as 29 <a href="national%20records%20in%20athletics">national records</a>. Many champions from the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%201999%20Southeast%20Asian%20Games">1999 edition</a> of the tournament retained their titles: <a href="Arumugam%20Munusamy">Arumugam Munusamy</a> (men's <a href="1500%20metres">1500 metres</a>) and <a href="Supriati%20Sutono">Supriati Sutono</a> (women's <a href="5000%20metres">5000 metres</a>) won their third straight <a href="SEA%20Games">SEA Games</a> titles, <a href="Juthaporn%20Krasaeyan">Juthaporn Krasaeyan</a> had her third consecutive women's <a href="shot%20put">shot put</a> and <a href="discus%20throw">discus throw</a> double, <a href="Loo%20Kum%20Zee">Loo Kum Zee</a> won his fourth men's <a href="high%20jump">high jump</a> gold, <a href="James%20Wong%20Tuck%20Yim">James Wong Tuck Yim</a> took a fifth title in the men's discus and <a href="Nur%20Herman%20Majid">Nur Herman Majid</a> extended his unbeaten run in the <a href="110%20metres%20hurdles">110 metres hurdles</a> to six titles.
Thailand had a sweep of the <a href="relay%20%28athletics%29">relays</a> and several Thai athletes won multiple gold medals. <a href="Reanchai%20Sriharwong">Reanchai Sriharwong</a> and <a href="Supavadee%20Khawpeag">Supavadee Khawpeag</a> did the <a href="100%20metres">100</a>/<a href="200%20metres">200 metres</a> sprint double on the men's and women's sides respectively, with Khawpeag breaking the <a href="List%20of%20Thai%20records%20in%20athletics">Thai records</a> in the process. <a href="Wassana%20Winatho">Wassana Winatho</a> won the women's <a href="400%20metres">400 metres</a> flat and <a href="400%20metres%20hurdles">hurdles</a>, while <a href="Nattaporn%20Nomkanha">Nattaporn Nomkanha</a> was the men's gold medallist in the <a href="long%20jump">long jump</a> and <a href="triple%20jump">triple jump</a>. Outside of Thailand, three other athletes topped the individual podium twice. The Philippines' <a href="Eduardo%20Buenavista">Eduardo Buenavista</a> won the 5000 m and <a href="3000%20metres%20steeplechase">3000 metres steeplechase</a> (knocking fifteen seconds off the games record in the latter). <a href="Pham%20Dinh%20Khanh%20Doan">Pham Dinh Khanh Doan</a> did a women's <a href="middle-distance%20running">middle-distance</a> double for <a href="Vietnam">Vietnam</a>, while Indonesia's Supriyati Sutono improved the standards for the 5000 m and <a href="10%2C000%20metres">10,000 metres</a>, setting meet records in both.
